entries.meaning: A choice that has been permitted.
A rhetorical device in which a thing is predicated on the decision of one's opponent.

verbs.description: permiss (third-person singular simple present permisses, present participle permissing, simple past and past participle permissed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, nonstandard, rare) To grant permission to; permit
examples: The catheter was connected through a forked tube either with electromanometer (or a mercury manometer), or with a pressurized reservoir system through a cock permissing to switch arbitrarily one or the other.
